Original title: The Last Airbender
Genre: Action, Adventure, Fantasy
Length: 103 min
Country: USA

Released in Spain: 06/08/2010
DVD release (sale): 08/12/2010
Blu-ray release: 08/12/2010
Studio: Paramount Pictures
Director: M. Night Shyamalan
Writer: M. Night Shyamalan
Starring: Noah Ringer, Dev Patel, Nicola Peltz, Jackson Rathbone, Shaun Toub, Aasif Mandvi, Cliff Curtis, Seychelle Gabriel, Katharine Houghton, Francis Guinan, Damon Gupton, Summer Bishil, Randall Duk Kim, John D'Alonzo, Keong Sim
Rating: Not recommended for children under 7 years


Synopsis:
The world is enveloped in the flames of war, and nobody has the power to stop the inevitable destruction ... so far.

For nearly a century, the Fire Nation has carried out its deadly campaign to dominate the entire world to its inhabitants, the tribes of Air, Water and Earth. But provides an alternative to the tribes who succumb to its power: total surrender, or complete annihilation.

While the villagers try to resist in vain, follow the select few who can control the element of their nation and to obey his orders. However, fire warriors, supported by vast armies and weapons of mass destruction, have already eliminated all the masters of air on the planet, and now focus their attention on the Nation's Water, headquartered in his northern stronghold.

One day, the young woman Katara water (Nicola Peltz) is out practicing his techniques with his brother Sokka (Jackson Rathbone) when they encounter a young boy named Aang (Noah Ringer). But, the powers become apparent as the master of Air Aang, Katara and Sokka realize that they have found something more than the last master of the Air. To be the Airbender of the prophecies (the only one who can control the four elements), the young master of the Air is the only weapon that can repel attack the Fire Nation and restore balance to the world finally torn by war. But will he get to master their techniques of control and become the hero that needs to be before it is too late?

Production notes:
- Based on the animated television series Avatar: The Last Airbender from Nickelodeon.
- Paramount Pictures and Nickelodeon Movies debuting worldwide film M. Night Shyamalan's' Airbender: The Ultimate Warrior "in 3D starting with the USA premiere is July 2, 2010. The film will be released simultaneously in 3D.
- Stereo D is overseeing the transformation of the 3D film. This company has worked recently in part of the conversion to 3D James Cameron film "Avatar."
- Paramount is proud to present Night vision with the latest technology, creating a fun cinematic experience for audiences of all ages.
